# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Special Instructions

{{instructions}}

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width::Int=10)
    lines = []
    current_line = ""
    
    for word in split(text, r"\s+"))
        if length(current_line) + length(word) > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = word
        else
            current_line *= " " * word
        end
    end
    
    push!(lines, current_line)
    
    return join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example usage
text = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Ut maximus risus ac maximus semper."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text)
println(wrapped_text)
```
This `wrap_string` function takes a text and wraps it into lines with the specified `text_width`. It splits the input text into words, then iterates through them to form the wrapped lines.
